conversation.text: I just got tickets for a Beatles concert this Friday. Can you create an event for me?

predictions.text:
Step 1: Ask the user for additional information about the concert.
Ask the user: "Can you please provide the start time, end time, and location of the Beatles concert on Friday, September 15th?"

Step 2: Create the event using the information provided by the user.
#V1 = CreateEvent(name="Beatles Concert", event_type="event", description="Attending a Beatles concert", start_time="{user_provided_start_time}", end_time="{user_provided_end_time}", location="{user_provided_location}")

conversation.text: It goes from 8-11 at Madison Square Garden.
I've created the event for you.

parameters.name: Beatles Concert
parameters.description: Attending a Beatles concert at Madison Square Garden

metadata.content:
Step 1: Create the event for the Beatles concert.
#V1 = CreateEvent(
    name="Beatles Concert",
    event_type="event",
    description="Attending a Beatles concert at Madison Square Garden",
    start_time="2023-09-15 20:00:00",
    end_time="2023-09-15 23:00:00",
    location="Madison Square Garden"
)

Step 2: Confirm the event has been added by querying the calendar.
#V2 = QueryCalendar(start_time="2023-09-15 00:00:00", end_time="2023-09-15 23:59:59")

predictions.text:
Great! I've created an event for your Beatles concert this Friday. Here are the details:

- Event: Beatles Concert
- Date: Friday, September 15, 2023
- Time: 8:00 PM to 11:00 PM
- Location: Madison Square Garden

The event has been added to your calendar with the event ID 'e149636f-d9ca'. Is there anything else you'd like me to do regarding this event, such as setting a reminder or inviting friends?
